description.narrative: The Project is expected to have positive economywide impacts in terms of job creation and value added, driven largely by the expansion of bread lines. In terms of market impact, Bauducco is expected to increase competitiveness of the sector through demonstration and replication effects.

The proposed IFC investment consists of an A loan to Pandurata Alimentos Ltda (Bauducco or the Company). Bauducco, founded in 1952, is a baked products company headquartered in Brazil, producing long shelf-life bread, panettones, toasts, and other baked products. The Company produces baked products under 3 complementary brands (Bauducco, Visconti and Tommy) to target different consumer segments. Bauducco is currently carrying out an investment program of about US$40 million over the next 2 years to expand its Bonsucesso plant to install an additional bread production line (the Project).
